DataElement.preferredName: Breast Conservation Treatment Eligibility Assessment Ind
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A response related to eligibility assessments of Breast Conservation Therapy (BCT). Â

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Breast conservation treatment (BCT) is defined as excision of the primary tumor and adjacent breast tissue, followed by radiation therapy.  This procedure is also referred to as lumpectomy, segmental mastectomy, or partial mastectomy. (from Consensus Statements: Treatment of Early-stage Breast Cancer, 1990)_Criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Breast conservation treatment is defined as excision of the primary tumor and adjacent breast tissue, followed by radiation therapy.  This procedure is also referred to as lumpectomy, segmental mastectomy, or partial mastectomy. (from Consensus Statements: Treatment of Early-stage Breast Cancer, 1990)

Concepts.definition: Breast conservation treatment is defined as excision of the primary tumor and adjacent breast tissue, followed by radiation therapy.
